text: Do you know if there is a way to provide hapikey via a header rather than via a query parameter?
Are quotes no longer available vie the api?
Hi Nick, correct, the DELETE action for a e-comm sync message will not remove the object from HubSpot. Its only purpose is to prevent it from syncing in the future.

For example; if you wanted to delete a contact or deal that had previously synced to HubSpot; the delete action wouldn't actually delete the contact or deal in HS, it would only prevent it from sync in future messages. To delete the contact or deal programmatically you would have to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/delete_contact|delete a contact> or <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/deals/delete_deal|deal> API.
Hope this helps, let me know if you have any further questions

Hello!
Using the HubSpot's API v3, I need to get Deal by Deal including the list of its Line Items.
This is my request URL: [GET] <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/87625555?limit=10&archived=false&hapikey=MY_API_KEY>
But this doesn't return the list of its Line Items.

Then, if I make a request to the Line Items's object, they don't have the Deal they belong to.
[GET] <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items?limit=10&archived=false&hapikey=MY_API_KEY>

I know using the Associations object, I can get which Line Items belong to which Deal, however, this required extra requests. Does anybody know of a more direct way of doing this?

Thanks!
